review: I'm having loads of fun catching up on the Korean historical dramas I've missed since my satellite provider dropped KBS and would have rated this product 5 stars, if not for one annoying glitch.  Occasionally the screen freezes, even though there is still a good wifi connection.  I would have blamed this on buying a refurbished unit but then found it's a common complaint, even with a brand new unit.  Luckily, I found a quick fix online and will share.  If you get no response after hitting every button on the remote and you know you're still online, do this:  Remove the batteries from the remote.  Unplug the power from the stick, wait 5 seconds and plug back in.  When the bouncing 'ROKU' screen appears, replace the batteries in the remote.  Press the reset button in the battery cavity and hold for 5 seconds.  The system will then reboot.  This is much better than throwing the remote across the room and burning your partner's ears with a stream of profanities.
author: Phyllis
